page.title: 01Castle Acre Northwards
page.content: Castle Acre (population about 1000) is picturesque with many flint and tiled houses. Its ruined 11th C Castle (and Priory in adjoining block) attract tourists. It is a Conservation Area. Over 40 new houses have been built in the last 10 years, bringing in new blood. Its school (infants) is threatened with closure. There is no industry here and indigenous employment is mostly connected with agriculture. Other inhabitants work in nearby towns. Unemployment is low. Nearby is the hamlet of Newton (population less than 50). Outsided the village the countryside rolls gently, ranging from 100 to 150 feet above sea level. Trees are mainly found in shelter belts and characteristic round coppices.
